thread.title: Woman who lost fingers and legs to sepsis warns of dangers
thread.title_full: Woman who lost fingers and legs to sepsis warns of dangers | Meridian - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Woman who lost fingers and legs to sepsis warns of dangers
text:
Thousands of lives are being lost every year because doctors are failing to spot a blood-poisoning condition known as sepsis.
It can strike very quickly and causes the body to attack its own organs and tissues. Now it's been revealed that far more people are dying than previously thought.
Derek Johnson met one woman, from Hove, who is recovering from its effects.
Play video You can find out more about Sepsis on the UK Sepsis Trust website, and on the NHS Choices website.
Last updated Mon 20 Feb 2017 Health Sussex Sepsis
